sen.j: 大伴榎本大国（おおとも の えのもとのおおくに、生没年不詳）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OTOMO no Enomoto no Okuni (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
OTOMO no Enomoto no Okuni (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
OTOMO no Enomoto no Okuni (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「おほとものえのもとのおほくに」。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as "OHOTOMO no Enomoto no Ohokuni".
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as "OHOTOMO no Enomoto no Ohokuni".
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as "OHOTOMO no Enomoto no Ohokuni".
His title hereditary was Muraji (second highest title under Yamato dynasty).
His hereditary title was Muraji (second highest title under Yamato dynasty).
sen.cmt: title hereditary は文法的に違います。
sen.e: His hereditary title was Muraji (second highest title under Yamato dynasty).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき大海人皇子（天武天皇）に従った。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama (the Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin war in 672.
He fought under Prince Oama (the Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin war in 672.
sen.cmt: この方が直訳より自然だとおもいます。
sen.e: He fought under Prince Oama (the Emperor Tenmu) during the Jinshin war in 672.

sen.j: 榎本氏は大伴氏の同族である。
sen.e: The Enomoto clan was in a same group as the Otomo clan.
The Enomoto family was in the same clan as the Otomo family.
sen.cmt: 氏をfamily, 同族をclanと訳しました。
sen.e: The Enomoto family was in the same clan as the Otomo family.

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、吉野宮にいた大海人皇子は兵力を持たなかった。
sen.e: When the Jinshin war started, Prince Oama was in Yoshino no miya and didn't have any military forces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: When the Jinshin war started, Prince Oama was in Yoshino no Miya palace and did not possess any military power.
sen.cmt: この方が自然です。あとこういった正式な文章を書く時Ｄｏｎ’ｔ等のように省略しません。yoshino no miya にわかりやすくpalace を足しました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin war started, Prince Oama was in Yoshino no Miya palace and did not possess any military power.

sen.j: そのため使者を出して美濃国で兵を集めさせつつそちらに向かった。
sen.e: Therefore, he sent envoys to mobilize the military in Mino Province while he was en route.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, he sent envoys to Mino Province to organize an army, while he was in route.
sen.cmt: mobilize the military とかくと軍がもとからあったように聞こえます。元からなかった軍を立ち上げたので、organize an army.
sen.e: Therefore, he sent envoys to Mino Province to organize an army, while he was in route.

sen.j: はじめ、6月24日に出発したとき、従う男子は20数人にすぎなかった。
sen.e: The first supporters were about two dozens of men when Prince Oama departed on June 24, and although OTOMO no Makuta and HAJI no Umate joined at Uoda (Uda-gun, Yamato province), it is believed that only three dozens of followers gathered.
When they departed on June 24th, there were only twenty some followers. Even after they were joined by OTOMO no Makuta and HAJI no Umate, there were only 30 or so men.
When they departed on June 24th, there were only twenty some followers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 莬田（大和国宇陀郡）で大伴馬来田や土師馬手の合流を得ても、30人前後だったと推測される。
sen.e: Even after they were joined by OTOMO no Makuta and HAJI no Umate, there were only 30 or so men.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 同日中に甘羅村を過ぎたところで、一行は大伴榎本大国に率いられた猟師20数人と出会った。
sen.e: On the same day, they met a group of two dozens of hunters lead by OTOMO no Enomoto no Okuni when they just passed Kamurano-mura village.
On the same day, after passing Kamura-mura village, they encountered a group of 20 or so hunters lead by OTOMO no Enomoto no Okuni.
sen.cmt: kamurano-mura から kamura-mura に変えました。文も自然に直しました。
sen.e: On the same day, after passing Kamura-mura village, they encountered a group of 20 or so hunters lead by OTOMO no Enomoto no Okuni.

sen.j: 大国らはすぐに一行に加わった。
sen.e: Okuni's group joined Prince's party immediately.
Okuni's group joined Prince's party immediately.
Okuni's group joined Prince's party immediately.

sen.j: 猟師は武器を携え使い慣れているので、このときの一行にとって心強い味方だったと想像できる。
sen.e: It is supposed that this was a great encouragement for Prince's party since the hunters carried arms and were very experienced in combat.
It can be imagined that this was a great encouragement for the Prince's party since the hunters were experienced with weaponry.
sen.cmt: experienced in combat とは書いていません。自然な文章に変訳。
sen.e: It can be imagined that this was a great encouragement for the Prince's party since the hunters were experienced with weaponry.

sen.j: 結局この脱出行で戦闘はおきず、その後の大国の活動について記録はない。
sen.e: No fight actually occurred during this escape and no records were kept of Okuni's acts later.
No fight actually broke out during this escape and no records were kept of Okuni's later actions.
sen.cmt: この表現の方がいいと思います。
sen.e: No fight actually broke out during this escape and no records were kept of Okuni's later actions.
